perturbation.original_text: Subject to the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement Cremer shall supply Ultragenyx with the Product free from defect and meeting the product specification attached to this Agreement as Annex A (the "Product Specifications").
perturbation.changed_text: Subject to the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement, Cremer shall use its best efforts to supply Ultragenyx with the Product, aiming to meet the product specification attached to this Agreement as Annex A (the "Product Specifications").
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates a defect-free product that meets specifications. The revised text changes 'shall supply' to 'shall use its best efforts to supply,' and states that they are 'aiming to meet the product specifications', making the obligation less strict and introducing uncertainty regarding the required level of conformity.

perturbation.original_text:
The prices payable by Ultragenyx to Cremer for the Product (the "Price") shall be agreed [***] every contract year; provided, that the Price may not increase more than the [***] for such period or [***]%, whichever is higher. At the date of signing the Parties agree on a Price of €[***] per kilogram for the Product.

2) If the parties cannot agree on a price for the Product by the beginning of a following contract year, Cremer may refuse to deliver the Product to Ultragenyx until the Parties agreed on a respective price.
perturbation.changed_text:
The prices payable by Ultragenyx to Cremer for the Product (the "Price") are intended to be agreed [***] every contract year; the parties will try to ensure the Price does not increase more than the [***] for such period or [***]%, whichever is higher. At the date of signing the Parties agree on a Price of €[***] per kilogram for the Product.

2) If the parties cannot agree on a price for the Product by the beginning of a following contract year, Cremer shall continue to deliver the Product to Ultragenyx based on the previous year's price until a new price is agreed upon.
perturbation.explanation: The original text stipulates that prices 'shall be agreed' annually, but the modified text softens this to prices are 'intended to be agreed'. This makes the yearly price agreement non-binding. Also, the original states Cremer may refuse delivery if a price isn't agreed upon, however the new text states they must continue at the old price. This directly conflicts with Article 3, 1) about price adjustments.

perturbation.original_text: Ultragenyx will perform final release of the Product. Ultragenyx may rely on the documentation provided by Cremer and Ultragenyx will not need to independently test the Product unless Ultragenyx determines such independent testing is necessary. In the event that the Product fails to conform to the Product Specifications, and/or GMP, Ultragenyx may reject the Product by giving written notice to Cremer within [***] days after receipt of the Product and all documentation (except such [***] day period will not apply for any latent defect). Within [***] days following receipt of the rejected and returned Product from Ultragenyx, Cremer will, at Ultragenyx's choice, replace such quantity of Product with Product conforming to the Product Specifications, and GMP or refund Ultragenyx the Price paid for such Product.
perturbation.changed_text: Ultragenyx will perform final release of the Product. Ultragenyx must always independently test the Product to ensure quality and safety, regardless of the documentation provided by Cremer. In the event that the Product fails to conform to the Product Specifications, and/or GMP, Ultragenyx may reject the Product by giving written notice to Cremer; however, this rejection is subject to Cremer's verification of non-conformity within [***] days. Within [***] days following confirmation of the rejected and returned Product from Ultragenyx, Cremer will make a reasonable effort to replace such quantity of Product with Product conforming to the Product Specifications, and GMP or refund Ultragenyx the Price paid for such Product.
perturbation.explanation: The original text allows Ultragenyx to rely on Cremer's documentation, whereas the modified text mandates independent testing. Also, the original states Cremer will replace or refund. The new text only states Cremer must make a reasonable effort to replace, adding uncertainty to the remedy and changing the conditions required for a rejection.
